page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF THE TADLEY AREA
page.content: The area covered by this survey is not one community, it includes parts of the parishes of Aldermaston, Brimpton including Brimpton Common, Wasing and Kingsclere, but in each case the village centre is outside the survey area, the majority of which is farm land, woods and heaths; but the south-eastern third consists of the Atomic Weapons Research Establishment at Aldermaston and the township of Tadley including Baughurst. The geology here is fairly simple. In the north around Brimpton, in the valleys of the Enborne and Kennet rivers, there are rich deposits of Alluvial and river gravels from which a long, wide, south-west/north-east trending ridge of Plateau gravels overlying Bagshot Beds and London Clay (Eocene) rises to form the greater part of the survey area.
